Detailed Description

Given a Symbol representing a function parameter, see if it or any contained types are varying. If so, issue an error. (This function should only be called for parameters to 'export'ed functions, where varying parameters is illegal.

llvm::Value *  structArgPtr,
Declarator *  decl,
FunctionEmitContext *  ctx 
) [static]

Parameters for tasks are stored in a big structure; this utility function emits code to copy those values out of the task structure into local stack-allocated variables. (Which we expect that LLVM's 'mem2reg' pass will in turn promote to SSA registers..

FILE *  file 
) [static]

Given a set of structures that we want to print C declarations of in a header file, order them so that any struct that is used as a member variable in another struct is printed before the struct that uses it and then print them to the given file.

static bool lInitFunSymDecl ( DeclSpecs *  ds,
Declarator *  decl 
) [static]

We've got a declaration for a function to process. This function does all the work of creating the corresponding llvm::Function instance, adding the symbol for the function to the symbol table and doing various sanity checks. This function returns true upon success and false if any errors were encountered.
